pr_title: DB-10025 Fix issues that cause a full IT run to fail.

timeline.bodyText: Can we get rid of spark.driver.allowMultipleContexts in tests and remove this special case?
timeline.author: dgomezferro

replies.bodyText: Done.  spark.driver.allowMultipleContexts doesn't exist in the tests.  This is just a spark setting I was experimenting with.  I've removed this option.
replies.author: msirek

timeline.bodyText: Please add a LOG here so it's clear why we are shutting down
timeline.author: dgomezferro

timeline.bodyText: Can you remove the stack trace from the comment? I think it makes sense to have it on the JIRA but not here (feel free to keep the explanation and a pointer to the JIRA for instance)
timeline.author: dgomezferro

timeline.bodyText: Can you move all these checks to a separate method to bring into focus the logic of the method?
timeline.author: dgomezferro

timeline.bodyText: Is this something that happens sometimes or just defensive programming?
timeline.author: dgomezferro

replies.bodyText: Yes, this is mainly just defensive programming.  I only ran across 2 of the assertions being hit (not the above 2 you highlighted), but I decided to handle all assertions, just in case.  An alternative would be to convert the assert statements into checks which throw IOExceptions.  These would be active on a cluster as well, whether or not assertions were enabled on it.
replies.author: msirek

timeline.message: DB-10025 Improve stability of the ITs.
DB-10025 Identify empty keys in more cases in tombstone purging logic.
DB-10025 Don't add first write marker when skipping transaction conflict detection.
DB-10025 A first write marker should only flag an insert or upsert, not a delete.
DB-10025 Avoid purging tombstones in problematic cases on a cluster.
DB-10025 Avoid crash on restore when the restore's txnId is not in cache.
DB-10025 Speed up the parallel ITs with forking.

Revert "DB-10025 Speed up the parallel ITs with forking."

This reverts commit b39c1c40b153247b302ad5897b30a8e85a41d098.

timeline.bodyText: More accurately, assertions are thrown during our IT runs as well.
timeline.author: arnaud-splice

timeline.bodyText: We may want to keep assertions because they are fired during ITs and can catch bugs. In case they are disables on a cluster, handleSanity Checks can safely bypass purge.
timeline.author: jyuanca

replies.bodyText: Looks like the same assertions were moved into the handleSanityChecks method, so they are being kept.
replies.author: jpanko1

replies.bodyText: They become warning messages and does not cause a failure for IT
replies.author: jyuanca

replies.bodyText: Feel free to write a Jira.  I'm merging now so it can get into this week's build.
replies.author: jpanko1
